item.title: Android vs iPhone: Security Models
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Android and iPhone OS (iOS) have been at loggerheads for quite some time now. This is a take on which has a better security model to protect its users. I thought of writing it up because there have been a lot of discussions around me lately about which platform is more secure and I keep repeating the same points over and over at every one of them, so thought that in future I'll just point them to this page :P

item.title: Windows Mobile: Missed Call Made Easy (Indian Cell Owners Rejoice)
item.author: shantanu@shantanugoel.com (Shantanu Goel)
item.description: Perdida = Missed Call (in Spanish) Missed Call = Ubiquitous Necessity (atleast in India) Enter: cPerdidas -> A Windows Mobile program (works with WM5 as well as WM6) that will allow you to make missed calls to anyone you desire. Just config your country code, select the contact and “Hacer Perdida!” (Make the missed call) and your contact will get the missed call on his device. The only change is that the program will cut the call even before he can hear his phone ring.
